Source code for maxairesources.model_approval.model_approver_spark

from pyspark.sql import DataFrame

from maxaibase.model.model_base import BaseModel



[docs]class ModelApprover:
    """
    gets model testing outputs actuals vs predicted,
    """

    def __init__(
        self,
        model: BaseModel,
        evaluator_class,
        predicted_actual_pdf: DataFrame,
        metric_thresholds: dict = {},
        **kwargs
    ):
        self.model = model
        self.predicted_actual_pdf = predicted_actual_pdf
        self.metric_thresholds = metric_thresholds
        
        self.evaluator = evaluator_class(predicted_actual_pdf=self.predicted_actual_pdf, **kwargs)        
        self.report = self.evaluator.get_evaluation_report()


[docs]    def is_above_threshold(self, threshold: dict = None):
        """
        check if the KPIs are above all thresholds or not
        :param
        threshold: dict
            {kpi:minimum value} pairs to check if model performance is above it or not.
        :return:
        good enough : bool
            if all kpis are about threshold then True, Else False
        """
        if threshold is None:
            threshold = self.metric_thresholds.copy()

        good_enough = True
        # if any KPI is not present
        if not set(threshold.keys()).issubset(set(self.report.keys())):
            raise Exception("Not all KPIs present")

        # check if all KPIs are met or not
        for kpi, threshold_val in threshold.items():
            if self.report[kpi] < threshold_val:
                good_enough = False

        return good_enough, self.model
